servers.description: Solace PubSub+ Cloud US EAST Region

get.summary: Get a list of the application domains
get.description: Use this API to get a list of application domains that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of application domains to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to be used to match the application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specify extra data to be included, options are: stats

200.description: Get a list of application domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To help keep your event-driven architecture organized, use application domains to create namespaces for your applications, events and schemas.

requestBody.description: Application domains have a name and topic domain.

201.description: Created. The newly saved application domain is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to get a single application domain by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specify extra data to be included, options are: stats

200.description: The application domain.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an application domain. This action also deletes all applications, events, and schemas in the application domain. You cannot undo this operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain.

patch.description: Use this API to update an application domain. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain.

200.description: The updated application domain.

post.summary: (Beta) Create application domains and their entities from import
post.description: Use this API to import application domains and their nested entities. Please note that this endpoint is in beta and could be subject to change in the future

202.description: Successfully registered import job with location identified in the response header

get.description: Use this API to get a list of applications that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of applications to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to match on.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only applications in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

parameters.name: applicationType
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given applicationType.

200.description: Get a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, applications are a fundamental building block for modelling the producers and consumers of events. Use this API to create applications and model the events they produce and consume.

requestBody.description: Applications have a name and live within an application domain. Events can be added to the application as produced or consumed.

201.description: Created an application. Returns the newly saved application in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to get a single application by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application.

200.description: The application.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application

patch.description: Use this API to update an application. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to update.

200.description: The updated application.

get.summary: Get a list of application versions
get.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to get a list of application versions that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: Match application versions with the given display name.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match application versions with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Match application versions with the given version.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of application versions.

*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Create an application version

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application

201.description: Created an application version. Returns the newly saved application version in the response body.

get.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version.

delete.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version

patch.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to update an application version. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version to update.

200.description: The updated application version.

patch.summary: Update the state of an application version
patch.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to update the state of an application version. You only need to specify the target stateId field.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version to update.

200.description: The updated state of the application version.

get.summary: Get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version
get.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version using the parent ID and the version's ID.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version.

parameters.name: showVersioning
parameters.description: Include versions in each AsyncAPI object's name when only one version is present

parameters.name: includedExtensions
parameters.description: The event portal database keys to include for each AsyncAPI object.

parameters.name: asyncApiVersion
parameters.description: The version of AsyncAPI to use

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format in which to get the AsyncAPI specification. Possible values are yaml and json.

parameters.name: messagingServiceId
parameters.description: Applies bindings from consumed events that are published in this messaging service's modeled event mesh.

200.description: The AsyncAPI specification for the application version.

parameters.name: applicationIds

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application versions with the given IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: messagingServiceIds
parameters.description: Match only application versions with the given messaging service IDs, separated by commas.

Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

get.description: Use this API to get a list of enumerations based on certain criteria.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enumerations to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The application domain ID of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only enumerations in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The names of the enumerations.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared enumerations.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of enumerations and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: An enumeration is a bounded variable with a limited set of literal values. Use this API to create an enumeration to define acceptable values for a level in a topic address or topic domain.

201.description: Created an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to get a single enumeration by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

200.description: The enumeration.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an enumeration. The enumeration must not have any versions or else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

204.description: No content is returned if the delete was successful.

404.description: If the enumeration did not exist.

patch.description: Use this API to update an enumeration object. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

200.description: Updated an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

post.description: Events are the primary building block of an event-driven architecture. Applications publish and subscribe to events and events reference schemas.  In the Event Portal, an event is a type of event as opposed to a specific event instance.

parameters.description: Match only event API products in the given application domain.

parameters.description: Match only event API products in the given application domains.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared event API products.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, schemas are a fundamental building block for modelling the payloads of the events flowing through your system. Use this API to create schemas that can later be referenced by events.

get.summary: Get a list of schema versions
get.description: Use this API to get a list of schema versions that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of schema versions to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: schemaIds
parameters.description: Match only schema versions of these schema IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only schema versions with the given IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of schema versions and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Creates a schema version

201.description: Created a schema version. The newly saved schema version is returned in the response body.

maxMsgSpoolUsage.description: Total number of MBs available for the queue to use
